page.title: 04Farming 1
page.content: {Kingswaey Farm,Tintagel. Owners_Mr.& Mrs.P.Scott. The farmland starts at 400'above sea level rising to 1000'.The modern farm house is on the snow line.The lower land is used for fattening cattle and growing corn.The higher ground is the highest cultivated land in Cornwall. The farm consists of 540 acres plus 75 acres of common land at Trewarmett Down and 80 acres rented for permanent grazing. The animals are fattened for slaughter.There is a single suckle herd consisting of Hereford cows and Charolais bulls.The calves are fed intensively and all the silage and cereal needed are grown on the farm. There is a breeding ewe flock of North Country Cheviot sheep. {Machinery}_silage mower conditioner, precision chop silage mower,buck rake.
